title: Ticket #2535: deltacloud test failure in new NMI on x86_64_rhap_6.1
description:
Here's the error I see:

11/10/10 12:34:59: Saw job abort cluster 001 job 000 job_deltacloud_basic: FAILURE (job aborted by user) 11/10/10 12:34:59: CT:job_deltacloud_basic: FAILED job_deltacloud_basic: CondorTest::RunTest() failed bad

Here's the test I see it from. It is happening every time the test executes.

http://submit-2.batlab.org/results/task-details.php?platform=nmi:x86_64_rhap_6.1&task=job_deltacloud_basic-1&type=test&runid=16710
remarks:
2011-Oct-11 10:00:42 by kronenfe:
This is also happening on x86_64_deb_6 now

http://submit-2.batlab.org/results/task-details.php?platform=nmi:x86_64_deb_6.0&task=job_deltacloud_basic-1&type=test&runid=16808

2011-Oct-11 10:10:58 by jfrey:
I looked at the x86_64_rhap_6.1 failure linked above. The deltacloud_gahp is reporting Deltacloud_Init_Failure: Failed to perform transfer: Server returned nothing (no headers, no data). The deltacloudd server doesn't have any unusual messages in its output.

2011-Oct-11 20:09:18 by jfrey:
I've done some additional interactive testing on x86_64_deb_6. Everything works fine on the old batlab machine nmi-v030. On the new batlab machine exec-2, the deltacloudd server is very slow to respond, and manual testing using wget results in repeated timeouts and wget sometimes never succeeding to retrieve a page.

I copied my ruby+gems installation from nmi-v030 to exec-2 and get the same bad performance as the installation I built on exec-2. But if I strace ruby, it starts responding instantly to client queries. If I start the deltacloudd normally and start a client query with wget, it hangs as usual. If I then attach with strace to the ruby child process that's running the thin gem, the query is completed within a second.

2011-Oct-11 20:36:51 by jfrey:
Here's how you can debug this outside of Condor:
  • Install ruby, its gems, and the deltacloud server code as the test does.
  • Start the deltacloudd server as the test does
  • Run wget --http-user=mockuser --http-passwd=mockpassword http://localhost:3001/api/instances

2011-Oct-12 12:56:07 by jfrey:
I've done some manual testing on the x86_64_rhap_6.1 machine exec-13.batlab.org. The deltacloud server behaves the same as on exec-2. Normally, the client times out waiting for a reply. But if I attached to the server with strace, it replies immediately to client queries.

2011-Oct-17 12:49:19 by jfrey:
I've emailed the deltacloud guys for ideas as to what may be wrong.

2011-Oct-19 13:29:31 by jfrey:
At the direction of Chris Lalancette, I've created a bug ticket in Apache's system: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DTACLOUD-99

2016-Mar-11 14:07:44 by jfrey:
Since we're planning to drop support for deltacloud, I'm closing this ticket.
creator: kronenfe
